ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my skills in counting electrons in organometallic complexes, devising synthesis pathways from basic reaction mechanisms, and evaluating experimental results based on observed kinetics and spectroscopic data.
Very similar to the 2nd half of CHEM 252 (Inorganic), but more in depth

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is really well taught and has a good balance of math, concepts, and concrete examples. One major weakness is that the problem sets cover much more advanced material than the lectures, so it can be difficult to figure out how to start and what concepts to apply.

This course is clearly taught and structured. The material is interesting and engaging, and Nilay is a great professor. Problem sets are manageable and help guide you through the material, though they sometimes rely on concepts that weren't explicitly mentioned in class, so it was difficult to tell exactly what we needed to know for the exam.

Strengths- Excellent information, really in depth, great course material, fair exams, homeworks are reasonable length

Weaknesses- Nilay has a lot of wonderful information, which he says very quickly while writing information very quickly on the board which is difficult to read. I found it very difficult to take down enough notes each class because I struggled to keep up (though his stories do allow for a little bit of catch-up time regarding what he has written on the board). The course resources provided are helpful, but having resources specific to his lectures (such as access to past Zoom lectures, which could be made available a significant amount of time after the lecture they correspond to in order to provide an incentive to attend class, or handouts of each example reaction/each substrate survey) would really help with studying and reviewing notes to fill in the gaps of what was missed in class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This was one of the best-taught chemistry classes I've taken at Yale and the material is engaging and has a wide variety of applications. I would recommend this class to any chemistry major.
Yes, this is a great chemistry elective. The class is well-organized, and the workload is fair and manageable.
Yes, Nilay is a great professor and the course content is excellent
